bug.author: miroli
bug.description:
I would've submitted a pull request but perhaps I'm missing something here. from spacy.lang.sv import Swedish
nlp = Swedish()
[x.lemma_ for x in nlp('F√∂r tv√• √•r sedan')] outputs <denchmark-code>['F√∂r', 'tv√•', '√•ra', 'sedan'] </denchmark-code>
Here, the word (year) is lemmatized to (oar), which is obviously not correct. The mapping from to can be found in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/spacy/lang/sv/lemmatizer/lookup.py>spacy/lang/sv/lemmatizer/lookup.py</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.0.11 Platform: Darwin-16.7.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.6.4 Models: xx_ent_wiki_sm

comments.comment: Thanks for the report! (Unfortunately, this often happens with freely available tables and resources that get passed around a lot. They're never 100% perfect ‚Äì but I'm glad we have a community that spots and reports mistakes like this üôè) What would be the correct solution then? Should √•r be removed entirely, or should the mapping be replaced with something else? (If you have a second, you could also just submit a PR instead.)
should be removed entirely. I submitted <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/2241>a PR here</denchmark-link> .
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
